post.summary: Send a direct message to multiple Slack users with optional templating.
post.description: Sends direct messages to multiple Slack users. Supports both simple text messages and templated messages with dynamic content for each user.

ai.systemPrompt: To send messages to multiple users, provide `userIds` (array of strings, each starting with 'U') and `text`. The text can include template variables like {mention}, {user_name}, {user_email}, {user_title}, {user_phone}, {user_status}, {user_avatar}, {first_name}, {last_name}. If template variables are used, the function automatically fetches user info and personalizes each message. DO NOT ASSUME USER IDs BY NAME - use `getActiveUsersIds` to find userIds by name.

body.description: Body of the messageUsers sls call

userIds.description: The IDs of the users to send the message to. User IDs start with 'U'.

text.description: The text of the message to be sent. Can include template variables: {mention} (mentions user), {user_name} (user's name), {user_email} (email), {user_title} (job title), {user_phone} (phone), {user_status} (status), {user_avatar} (profile image), {first_name} (first name), {last_name} (last name). Template variables are automatically replaced with user data.

ok.description: true if the request was successful.

channel.description: The ID of the channel where the message was posted.

message.description: An object containing the details of the sent message.

bot_id.description: The ID of the bot that sent the message.

username.description: The username of the bot that sent the message.

400.description: Bad Request - The request was invalid or cannot be served.

500.description: Internal Server Error - The server has encountered a situation it doesn't know how to handle.
